samples.question: What is your job?
samples.transcript: Currently, I am an interpreter over the phone. I interpret phone calls from different government agencies and institutions from the US.
samples.transcript_original: Uh, currently, I'm an interpreter over the phone. I interpret phone calls from different government agencies and institutions from the US.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Currently, I am an interpreter over the phone. I interpret phone calls from different government agencies and institutions from the US.

samples.question: And has your job changed a lot in the past years?
samples.transcript: It actually has because up until August from this year, I used to be an English teacher. I had been an English teacher for over three years, but just recently I decided to switch to any job.
samples.transcript_original: It actually has because up until August from this year, I used to be an English teacher. I had been an English teacher for over three years, but just recently I decided to switch to any job.

samples.question: And if you had the chance, would you change your job?
samples.transcript: I think that if I had the chance, I would. but it depends on the conditions and the salary. If it is better than the one that I have right now, I would totally, I think I would totally change.
samples.transcript_original: I think that if I had the chance, I would. Uh, but it depends on the conditions and the salary. If it's better than the one that I have right now, I would totally, I think I would totally change.

samples.question: Do you use headphones?
samples.transcript: I do use headphones. I actually have a pair of headphones. I got them about two months ago. they are very useful and I really like them.
samples.transcript_original: I do use headphones. I actually have a pair of headphones. Um, I got them about two months ago. They're very useful and I really like them.

samples.question: And when would you use your headphones?
samples.transcript: I use them for my job. I take calls every day. So in order to have a better quality of my voice when I interpret or to hear better what my clients are saying, I use headphones.
samples.transcript_original: I use them for my job. I take calls every day. So in order to have a better quality of my voice when I interpret or to hear better what my clients are saying, I use headphones.

samples.question: In what conditions you will not use your headphones?
samples.transcript: I think I would not use my headphones on my personal life apart from the job because they are very big and heavy. So to go jogging or to just, relax in my room, I would not use them. let us now talk about shoes.

samples.question: How frequently do you buy shoes?
samples.transcript: I think I buy shoes around one to two times a year. I do not really buy that many shoes. I am not the kind of person that collects a lot of them. I just stick to a few good ones.
samples.transcript_original: I think I buy shoes around one to two times a year. I don't really buy that many shoes. I'm not the kind of person that collects a lot of them. I just stick to a few good ones.

samples.question: And where do you usually buy shoes?
samples.transcript: I go buy them at the mall. I do not like buying them online because I do not want to risk it because sometimes they come a little bit larger or smaller. So I would rather.

samples.question: What is your favorite type of shoes?
samples.transcript: I think sneakers. Sneakers are my favorite type of shoes. they are comfortable and they are useful for everything.

samples.question: So can you please give me back the papers and the pen?
samples.transcript: Thank you Okay so in the second part you talked about charity which is important to you Now in the third part I want to ask you some questions related to this topic Why do people do charity for others I think people do charity for others because it is part of the empathetic side of the human heart to just, see the needs in other people and just help them out with that because everybody struggles.

samples.question: And do you think charity work is a selfish thing to do?
samples.transcript: It depends on the intentions of the person that does it because some people generally, help without expecting anything in return. But there is other people that expect some recognition or just to feel like they are, good people for doing small actions.

samples.question: And what kinds of charities are there in your country?
samples.transcript: Oh, there are many charities in my country, but the most famous ones are Teleton, which is for disabled children. Red Nose for children with cancer. And there are many that help the elderly as well.
samples.transcript_original: Oh, there are many charities in my country, but the most famous ones are Teleton, which is for disabled children. Red Nose for children with cancer. And there are many that help the elderly as well.

samples.question: And which one do you think is more useful or is more needed for your leave?
samples.transcript: I think all of them are important and useful, but I think the ones related to children and the elderly are the most important ones.

samples.question: Why do you think so?

samples.question: Do they also contribute to charity?
